definition:
The [*London Mathematical Society*]{} (LMS) is an association of
professional mathematicians in the United Kingdom, headquartered in
London, England. Established in 1865 in London, the Society was granted
royal charter by Queen Elizabeth II at its centennial celebrations. In
1888, Thomas Fiske visited from America, and was inspired to found the
New York Mathematical Society (later renamed American Mathematical
Society) upon his return.
